definition: A piece of fabric or material that is typically attached to a structure or vehicle, designed to catch and utilize the force of the wind to propel the object forward. It is commonly found on boats and ships, serving as a means of propulsion by harnessing the wind's power.

examples.german: Das Segelboot fährt schnell über das Wasser.
examples.english: The sailboat is sailing fast over the water.

examples.german: Er hat das Segel gehisst, um den Wind zu nutzen.
examples.english: He hoisted the sail to catch the wind.

examples.german: Das Segel des Schiffes ist aus robustem Material gefertigt.
examples.english: The ship's sail is made of sturdy material.

examples.german: Die Segel wurden eingeholt, als der Sturm aufkam.
examples.english: The sails were furled when the storm came.

examples.german: Sie segeln gerne auf dem See in ihrer Freizeit.
examples.english: They enjoy sailing on the lake in their free time.
